reviewText: This movie may be off of the Love Comes Softly Series by Janette Oke but this movie is still a good movie to watch for the entire family. Love Begins is the first movie in this series.  If you like good, Christian family fun then this movie is right for you and your family.

reviewText: This is a movie that should be viewed after "Love  Begins". Both are very fine Hallmark creations that put the meaningful things in life front and center: love, hardship, redemption, loss, and recovery through family affection. Can you name anything close produced recently like this? And believe it when I say younger children can relate!
Title: Love's Everlasting Courage

reviewText: The 411 by Maria:Since I am new series, this was a big surprise for me and now I must see Love Begins. I believe I hosted a giveaway but never saw it myself.  I love this era of movies. Reminds me of all the years I watched Little House On The Prarie. Julie Mond who plays Ellen for all your General Hospital fans played Lisa Niles for a while. Love her! It was strange seeing Cheryl Ladd as someone's grandma.  Great cast.When the Davis family's farm takes a hit from the drought, Ellen does what any loving wife would do for her family; she takes a job as a seamstress in town. When Clark's parents come to visit, his mother Irene is concerned that Ellen is working "in my day wives didn't work." Clark's dad, Lloyd played by Bruce Boxleitner completely understands how his son's family is struggling and wants to help the farm.Ellen is stricken with Scarlet Fever and Clark must be a full time parent to their young daughter Missy, adorably played by Morgan Lily who I fell in love with in 2012 and Flipped.Clark's parents are the perfect supportive parents we all wish for and through their help, the Davis Family work together through love to keep their hearts open.What I love most about this movie which was one of Hallmark's highest viewed series is the simplicity and quietness of life, family and love. I was often reminded of Little House on the Prairie and spent some time trying to find out where it was filmed but couldn't find much.Wonderful family movie about the love of family.
summary: Family Friendly Movie about A Parent's Love
Title: Love's Everlasting Courage

reviewText: This film has a tough assignment.  It has to build a bridge between "Love Begins" (Clark wins Ellen) and "Love Comes Softly" (Clark is a widower...).The bridge works; it connects past and future, and makes a good job of it.  It explains how Clark's first wife died, and where he got the firm faith that God will be with us when all our best efforts fail and life is collapsing around us.It is a sound link in the series, potentially more helpful (though less entertaining) than "Love Begins" and "Love Comes Softly."
Title: Love's Everlasting Courage
